KeywordDictionary.title: SOFIA Keyword Dictionary
KeywordDictionary.author: R. Y. Shuping/E. Moore / L. Lin

Keyword.title: Datasource

Value.Range: ASTRO, CALIBRATION, LAB, TEST, OTHER, FIRSTPOINT

Keyword.title: ObservationType
Keyword.Description: The type of observation such as an astronomical exposure or a particular type of calibration exposure: OBJECT = astronomical object; STANDARD = Astronomical flux standard for calibration; LAMP = Calibration lamp; FLAT = Flat-field exposure for calibration; DARK = Dark current exposure for calibration.

Value.Range: OBJECT, STANDARD_FLUX, STANDARD_TELLURIC, STANDARD_WAVECAL, LAMP, FLAT, DARK, BIAS, SKY, BB, GASCELL, LASER, FOCUS_LOOP

Keyword.title: SourceType
Keyword.Description: Source type. Maps to AOR SourceType. Needed for reduction of slit spectra, but useful for other data types as well.

Keyword.title: ObservationStatus
Keyword.Description: Status of the observation: OK = observation performed successfully; ERROR = Observation completed but with an error.

Keyword.title: KeywordDictionaryVersion
Keyword.Description: SOFIA keyword dictionary version. Since the keywrod dictionary is now a part of the DCS ICD (DCS_SI_01, this keyword should reference which version of the ICD is being used. The document rev (A, B, C, etc...) should be appended to the string 'DCS_SI_01' with an underscore (see example).
Keyword.Comment: SOFIA Keyword dictionary version, DCS ICD rev.

Keyword.title: ObservationID
Keyword.Description: The unique identifier for any given data file, meant to provide ready timing and sequencing information at a glance to the user. It is created at the same time that the data file is first written, in a format common to all instruments (and thus mandated by the observatory). The OBS_ID is assigned to saved datasets only. Some test data may be taken during a flight for immediate diagnostic purposes, but not saved (e.g., a snapshot to verify pointing), in which case there would be no point in assigning an OBS_ID, but we note that the default should almost always be to save the data and thus assign this keyword. The OBS_ID number is distinct from the AOR_ID. The AOR_ID is the unique identifier for an AOR which can, in principle, generate multiple files to be saved. Each of these files would have a unique OBS_ID. The mapping from AOR_ID to OBS_ID is one-to-many, i.e., one AOR can produce multiple data files. Note that the converse is not true -- one data file cannot be the product of multiple AORs. We suggest the following as a format for the OBS_ID keyword: MMMMMM_[C]nnn. Where: MMM = Mission ID (see MissionID) -- Data not taken as part of a SOFIA mission should set MMM to current date or some other suitable value; C = Channel identifier (optional) -- preferably a letter (B for Blue, S for short, etc...); nnn = Observation sequence number -- The sequence should be reset at mission start and advanced all the way through mission close-out (as defined my the MCCS), which should allow for capture of pre- and post-flight data -- This field will have a minimum of three digits (typical expected length), but more digits will be allowed as necessary.

Keyword.title: ObservationSerialNumber
Keyword.Description: Running count of observation number for observing session or flight, starting with 1. This value should be identical to the observation sequence number appended to the ObservationID.
Keyword.Comment: Running count of observation number for observing session or flight.

Keyword.title: ImageID
Keyword.Description: The image identification when there are multiple images for an observation within the SAME file (e.g. images stored as FITS extensions).

Requirement.condition: Multiple images in a single file for an observation

Keyword.title: ObjectName
Keyword.Description: The object name as given by the observer, or as specified by the flight plan.

Keyword.title: AOTUniqueID
Keyword.Description: Unique Astronomical Observation Template (AOT) identifier as defined in SI-DCS ICD. AORs generated from SOFIA SSpot are based on the [SI]-DCS ICD which defines AOTs, the combination of the AOT name, ICD document number, and the ICD version number can uniquely identify an AOT version. Note that the ICD version number is important, AOTs in different versions of ICD can sometimes have conflict values.

Value.Example: 'FLITECAM_Imaging AOT SCI-US-ICD-SE03-2044, revB, AOT_FORCAST_GRISM SCI-US-ICD-SE03-2001 Rev. D'

Keyword.Comment: Astronomical Observation Template Identifier, most SI already use the correct format, clarified in revF

Keyword.title: AORUniqueID
Keyword.Description: Unique Astronomical Observation Request (AOR) identifier. The AOR_ID is assigned during the creation of the final version of an AOR to be used in flight planning. The value of this keyword should be equivalent to the AOR/ID tag in the AOR document. During Early Science, the AOR ID will be equivalent to the proposed observation ID and will be documented in the observing plan. The AOR_ID should not be reused once data is taken for this AOR to define a different observation. For example, 90_0004_1 has been observed for SA 114-656, it should not be reused to observe SA 114-670 even if all other parameters are exactly the same.
Keyword.Comment: Astronomical Observation Request Identifier. Clarified format in revF to be [PLANID]_n, n is an integer from 1 to 9999

Keyword.title: FileGroupID
Keyword.Description: Identifier for a group of images stored as seperate data files. This is the mechanism for associating multiple data files that should be considered together. Can be defined by the user -- not necessarily unique in the SOFIA mission. For example, suppose a map of Orion is made such that each individual map point is stored in a seperate file. The user could then set this keyword to something like "OrionMap_20040101" for each of the files so that they can be associated later.

Keyword.title: ProcessingStatus
Keyword.Comment: Processing status, required for all SI starting revF

Keyword.title: HeaderStatus
Keyword.Description: Status of FITS header data (updated during post-processing). ORIGINAL: Header values are from original raw data file and have not been modified. UNKNOWN: header values have not been reviewed/verified. CORRECTED: header values have been corrected as part of post-processing, see HISTORY records for details. ERROR: There is a problem with the header values that has not been fixed, see COMMENT records for details. SI would set HEADSTAT = 'ORIGINAL" for raw data acquired on the AC. MODIFIED: Headers have been changed but are not yet fully CORRECTED.
Keyword.Comment: Header status, added MODIFIED in revF

Keyword.title: DataQuality
Keyword.Description: Indicates overall data quality; indicator of scientific reliability for the dataset. Values are: NOMINAL: no outstanding issues with processing/calibration/observing conditions. USABLE: minor issue(s) with processing/calibration/conditions but should still be scientifically valid (perhaps with larger than usual uncertainties); see HISTORY records for details. PROBLEM: significant issue(s) encountered with processing, calibration, or observing conditions; may not be scientifically useful (depending on application); see HISTORY records for details. In general, these cases are addressed through manual re-processing before archiving and distribution. FAIL: data could not be processed successfully for some reason. These cases are rare and generally not archived or distributed to the GI.

Keyword.title: NumberOfSpectral
Keyword.Description: Number of spectral, optional for spectroscopic modes.
Keyword.Comment: Number of spectra included in file.

Keyword.title: PipelineName
Keyword.Description: Name of pipeline/processing software used to generate file (e.g. “FDRP v1.0.0”). LEVEL 2/3/4 data only.

Keyword.title: PipelineVersion
Keyword.Description: Full release tag for pipeline that produced the file (e.g. “FDRP_1_0_0_UT2013_4_1”). LEVEL 2/3/4 data only.

Keyword.title: ProductType
Keyword.Description: Type of product produced by the processing software or pipeline, as defined in SI-DCS ICD. Should be simple identifier that the GI can use to look up in the processing handbook or ICD. ID should include an identifier for the software that was used to produce the file (e.g. "DRIP_XXX"). For example, the FORCAST product types are: DRIP-UNDISTORTED, DRIP-MERGED, DRIP-COADDED, DRIP-REDALL. Generally, the SI will not need to set this keyword for raw data.

Keyword.title: DCSFileRevision
Keyword.Description: File revision identifier, to be inserted by archive ingestion tasks if file was modified as part of post-processing. Change details to be documented using HISTORY records at the end of the header. String value, typically a lower case 'r' (ASCII 114) immediately followed by a integer greater than zero in decimal format with no padding or leading zeros. E.g., "r1" not "r01". The SI will not need to set this keyword for raw data; included here for completeness.

Keyword.title: ObservingPlanUniqueID
Keyword.Description: The observing plan which contains all the AORs. The value of this keyword should be equivalent to <AOR/Reference/ObservingPlan> in the AOR document.

Keyword.title: AircraftDeployment
Keyword.Description: Aircraft base of operations for current instrument run.

Keyword.title: MissionID
Keyword.Description: Unique mission identifier, as specified in the Mission Plan and returned by the MCCS. Current spec for mission ID includes a date stamp, instrument ID, and mission type indicators.

Keyword.title: FlightLeg
Keyword.Description: Flight leg identifier for given mission ID.
Keyword.Comment: Flight leg, updated to fltexes_data from leg_data

Keyword.title: Origin
Keyword.Description: Organization or institution responsible for creation of FITS file.

Keyword.title: Observers
Keyword.Description: Observer name(s).

Keyword.title: FileCreator
Keyword.Description: Software task which wrote the FITS file (including version information).

Keyword.title: TelescopeOperator
Keyword.Description: The telescope operator for the mission. Can be obtained from list of active MCCS sessions (get list=active_session) if needed.

Keyword.title: Filename
Keyword.Description: Name of host file. The FILENAME keyword allows for different stages in the treatment of a dataset: raw, calibrated, custom reduced, pipelined, or reduced at an intermediate stage. Files resulting from actions taken upon a given raw dataset will all have the same OBS_ID, but could have different values of the FILENAME keyword. For the FILENAME format, we recommend using OBSID as a prefix, and attach qualifiers denoting the stage of treatment and format.

Keyword.title: Observatory
Keyword.Description: Observatory identification for the site of the observation.

Keyword.title: CreationDate
Keyword.Description: UTC date of file creation in date/time format (yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.ssss); see FITS standard for additional detail.

Keyword.title: ObservationDate
Keyword.Description: UTC date of observation at the start of the exposure in date/time format (yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.ssss); see FITS standard for additional detail.

Keyword.title: ObservationStartUTC
Keyword.Description: UTC time at the start of the exposure.

Keyword.title: ObservationEndUTC
Keyword.Description: UTC time at the end of the exposure.

Keyword.title: ObservationStartLST
Keyword.Description: Local siderial time at the start of the exposure.

Keyword.title: ObservationStartMJD
Keyword.Description: Modified Julian date at the start of the exposure. The fractional part of the date is given to better than a second of time.

Keyword.title: WaterVaporZenith_Start
Keyword.Description: Integrated precipitable water vapor to the zenith, running average of previous 60 seconds. Start of observation.
Keyword.Comment: Water vapor, integrated to zenith, observation start.

Keyword.title: WaterVaporZenith_End
Keyword.Description: Integrated precipitable water vapor to the zenith, running average of previous 60 seconds. End of observation.
Keyword.Comment: Water vapor, integrated to zenith, observation end.

Keyword.title: WaterVaporTALOS
Keyword.Description: Integrated precipitable water vapor along the TA line of sight, running average of previous 60 second
Keyword.Comment: Water vapor, integrated along TA LOS.

Keyword.title: static_air_temp
Keyword.Description: Static air temperature, as returned by the MCCS at start of observation.
Keyword.Comment: Static air temperature outside aircraft. (For Early Science: Value=NotSet)

Keyword.title: PrimaryMirrorTemperature_1
Keyword.Description: Primary mirror temp #1, at start of observation.

Keyword.title: PrimaryMirrorTemperature_2
Keyword.Description: Primary mirror temp #2, at start of observation.

Keyword.title: PrimaryMirrorTemperature_3
Keyword.Description: Primary mirror temp #3, at start of observation.

Keyword.title: SecondaryMirrorTemperature_1
Keyword.Description: Temperature of secondary mirror, at start of observation.

Keyword.title: Temperature
Keyword.Description: General format for temperatures.

Keyword.title: Altitude_Start
Keyword.Description: Aircraft altitude from mean sea level according to MCCS (baro corrected), at start of observation.
Keyword.Comment: Aircraft pressure altitude, start of observation.

Keyword.title: Altitude_End
Keyword.Description: Aircraft altitude from mean sea level according to MCCS (baro corrected), at end of observation.
Keyword.Comment: Aircraft pressure altitude, end of observation.

Keyword.title: Airspeed
Keyword.Description: True aircraft airspeed, as returned by the MCCS at start of observation.

Keyword.title: GroundSpeed
Keyword.Description: Current ground speed of aircraft, as returned by the MCCS at start of observation.

Keyword.title: Latitude_Start
Keyword.Description: Current aircraft latitude, as returned by the MCCS at start of observation.

Keyword.title: Longitude_Start
Keyword.Description: Current aircraft longitude, as returned by the MCCS at start of observation. W is negative, E is positive, from prime meridian.

Keyword.title: Latitude_End
Keyword.Description: Current aircraft latitude, as returned by the MCCS at end of observation.

Keyword.title: Longitude_End
Keyword.Description: Current aircraft longitude, as returned by the MCCS at end of observation. W is negative, E is positive, from prime meridian.

Keyword.title: Heading
Keyword.Description: True aircraft heading, as returned by the MCCS at start of observation.

Keyword.title: TrackAngle
Keyword.Description: Aircraft track angle, as returned by the MCCS at start of observation.

Keyword.title: Telescope
Keyword.Description: Telescope used for the observation. Usually SOFIA but can also be telescope an another observatory.

Keyword.title: TelescopeConfig
Keyword.Description: Telescope configuration. The configuration defines the mirrors, correctors, light paths, etc... On SOFIA, this should be controlled by the MCCS.

Keyword.title: TelescopeRA
Keyword.Description: Right ascension of SI boresight (SIBS), as returned by the telescope control system (J2000). Representation may be either decimal hours or HH:MM:SS.s.
Keyword.Comment: SI Boresight RA (J2000) - as returned by MCCS, , removed type str in revF

Keyword.title: TelescopeDec
Keyword.Description: Declination of SI boresight, as returned by the telescope control system (J2000). Representation may be either decimal degrees or DD:MM:SS.
Keyword.Comment: SI Boresight Dec (J2000) - as returned by MCCS, removed type str in revF

Keyword.title: TelescopeVPA
Keyword.Description: Vertical Position Angle (VPA) of SI boresight, as returned by the telescope control system in ICRS (J2000) -- Is this really VPA or ROF? -- TBC.
Keyword.Comment: SI Boresight VPA (ICRS J2000) - as returned by MCCS

Keyword.title: TelescopeEquinox
Keyword.Description: Equinox of returned RA/Dec/VPA.

Keyword.title: LastRewindUTC
Keyword.Description: UTC time of last telescope rewind.

Keyword.title: TelescopeFocus_Start
Keyword.Description: Telescope focus: Measured position of the FCM focus mechanism in the T direction -- as returned by the MCCS (microns) at observation start.
Keyword.Comment: Telescope focus - SMA FCM t position (microns), observation start.

Keyword.title: TelescopeFocus_End
Keyword.Description: Telescope focus: Measured position of the FCM focus mechanism in the T direction -- as returned by the MCCS (microns) at observation end.
Keyword.Comment: Telescope focus - SMA FCM t position (microns), observation end.

Keyword.title: TelescopeElevation
Keyword.Description: Telescope elevation above the horizon. At start of observation.
Keyword.Comment: Telescope elevation above the horizon at observation start - as returned by MCCS. Changed source from coord.pos.sibs.el to coord.pos.sibs.alt in revF.

Keyword.title: TelescopeCrossElevation
Keyword.Description: Telescope cross elevation in the cavity reference frame. At start of observation.
Keyword.Comment: Telescope cross elevation at observation start - as returned by MCCS

Keyword.title: TelescopeLineOfSight
Keyword.Description: Telescope line of sight angle in the cavity reference frame. At start of observation.
Keyword.Comment: Telescope LOS at observation start - as returned by MCCS

Keyword.title: TascuStatus
Keyword.Description: State of the TASCU system at the end of the current observation as returned by the MCCS. See specification in MCCS_SI_04.

Keyword.title: TascuFBCStatus
Keyword.Description: State of the flexible body compensation system at the end of the current observation as returned by the MCCS. See specification in MCCS_SI_04.

Keyword.title: ObservationRequestRA
Keyword.Description: Requested right ascension for the observation before any manual "tweaking", either from the instrument control software, an AOR, or the flight executor. This may be different from the actual object coordinates and/or telescope coordinates. Representation may be either decimal hours or HH:MM:SS.s. Reference frame can be specified in the comment field (ICRS recommended) and equinox specified using the Equinox keyword.

Keyword.title: ObservationRequestDec
Keyword.Description: Requested declination for the observation before any manual "tweaking", either from the instrument control software, an AOR, or the flight executor. This may be different from the actual object coordinates and/or telescope coordinates. Representation may be either decimal degrees or DD:MM:SS. Reference frame can be specified in comment field (ICRS recommended) and equinox specified using the Equinox keyword.

Keyword.title: EquatorialCoordSystem
Keyword.Description: Equatorial coordinate system spec for requested RA and Dec (OBSRA and OBSDEC). See FITS standard for additional detail. If not specified, coords are assumed to be ICRS (J2000).
Keyword.Comment: Equatorial coord system for OBSRA and OBSDEC

Keyword.title: ObservationRequestEquinox
Keyword.Description: Equinox for ObservationRA and ObservationDec. Does not apply to TelescopeRA/Dec which are fixed to ICRS (J2000). See FITS standard for additional detail. If not specified, equinox is assumed to be year 2000.
Keyword.Comment: Coordinate equinox for OBSRA and OBSDEC

Keyword.title: ZenithAngle_Start
Keyword.Description: Zenith angle of telescope pointing at start of acquisition. Use telescope elevation to calculate ZA.
Keyword.Comment: Telescope zenith angle, start of observation.

Keyword.title: ZenithAngle_End
Keyword.Description: Zenith angle of telescope pointing at end of acquisition. Use telescope elevation to calculate ZA.
Keyword.Comment: Telescope zenith angle, end of observation.

Keyword.title: HourAngle
Keyword.Description: Hour angle at start of acquisition. Representation may be either decimal hours or HH:MM:SS.s.

Keyword.title: SunAngle
Keyword.Description: Angular separation between telescope pointing and sun at start of acquisition.

Keyword.title: MoonAngle
Keyword.Description: Angular separation between telescope pointing and moon at start of acquisition.

Keyword.title: UserCoordSys
Keyword.Description: The name of a user defined coordinate system. Used to define object coordinates and offsets. If the value is USER, then it is assumed a new coordinate system is being defined based on a translation and rotation of a reference coordinate system defined in USRREFCR.

Value.Range: EQUATORIAL, GALACTIC, ECLIPTIC, FOCAL PLANE, USER

Keyword.title: UserReferenceCoordSys
Keyword.Description: Reference coordinate system used to define a new user coordinate system, when USRCRDSY =USER .

Keyword.title: UserOriginX
Keyword.Description: Origin of user defined coordinate system, i.e. translation from the reference coordinate system defined in USRREFCR.
Keyword.Comment: X origin of user defined coordinate system.

Keyword.title: UserOriginY
Keyword.Description: Origin of user defined coordinate system, i.e. translation from the reference coordinate system defined in USRREFCR.
Keyword.Comment: X origin of user defined coordinate system.

Keyword.title: UserRotation
Keyword.Description: Rotation of user defined coordinate system from USRREFCR.

Keyword.title: UserX
Keyword.Description: X coordinate of object in new user defined coordinate system.
Keyword.Comment: Object coordinate in new user defined coordinate system

Keyword.title: UserY
Keyword.Description: Y coordinate of object in new user defined coordinate system.
Keyword.Comment: Object coordinate in new user defined coordinate system

Keyword.title: UserEquinox
Keyword.Description: Equinox when equatorial coordinates are used.

Keyword.title: HelioVelocityCorrection
Keyword.Description: Velocity correction (DeltaV_helio) to bring observations into the heliocentric reference frame

Keyword.title: LSRVelocityCorrection
Keyword.Description: Velocity correction (DeltaV_LSR) to bring observations into the local standard of rest (LSR) reference frame

Keyword.title: TrackingMode
Keyword.Description: SOFIA Tracking mode (last commanded). See MCCS_SI_04 for descirption of states and modes.

Value.Range: OFF, CENTROID, ROF, LIMB, OFFSET,ROF+OFFSET, CENTROID+INERTIAL, ROF+INERTIAL, OFFSET+INERTIAL, ROF+OFFSET+INERTIAL

Keyword.title: TrackingError
Keyword.Description: Flag to indicate if there was a tracking error during the observation. Ideally the SI software would monitor the tracking mode (ta_trc.trc_status_table.main_op_mode_id) for any error/abnormalities. If an error does occur, the TRACERR would then be set to T. (

Keyword.title: isChopping
Keyword.Description: Chopping flag

Keyword.title: isNodding
Keyword.Description: Nodding flag -- this should be set if the SI is executing a repeated nod pattern, for example (ABBA)(ABBA), etc...

Keyword.title: isDithering
Keyword.Description: Dithering flag

Keyword.title: isMapping
Keyword.Description: Mapping flag.

Keyword.title: isScanning
Keyword.Description: Scanning flag.

Keyword.title: Comment
Keyword.Description: Comment keyword. This keyword does not normally have an equal sign. Any number of COMMENT records may be present from any legitimate source. This is a good place for <AOR/SpecialInstructions>.

Value.Example: These data on ORION are GRRRRREAAAT!

Keyword.Comment: Comments may be placed anywhere throughout the header.

Keyword.title: History
Keyword.Description: History keyword. This keyword does not normally have an equal sign. This keyword should be reserved for any processing of the data, especially pre-processing (i.e. instrument level). Any number of HISTORY records may be present.

Keyword.title: Error
Keyword.Description: Error information *useful to a guest investigator*; this is not meant to be a catalog of system errors. Any number of Error messages may be present. In the FITS implementation, sequence numbers are used to order the information. Generally this keyword should only be used if OBSTAT=ERROR.
Keyword.Comment: Error information. FITS: Suffix index can be used to order entries (1-999).

Keyword.title: Instrument
Keyword.Description: Instrument name, as specified in the SI-DCS ICD.

Keyword.title: Datatype
Keyword.Description: Type of observation data: Image, Spectral, ot Other.

Keyword.title: InstrumentConfiguration
Keyword.Description: Instrument configuration - simple description, as specified in the SI-DCS ICD. e.g. IMAGING, GRISM, SPECTROSCOPY, etc...

Keyword.title: InstrumentMode
Keyword.Description: Instrument observing mode - simple description, as specified in the SI-DCS ICD. e.g. C2D, MAPPING, etc...

Keyword.title: MCCSMode
Keyword.Description: SI mode as defined in the MCCS_SI_04.

Keyword.title: InstrumentHardwareVersion
Keyword.Description: Instrument hardware version.

Keyword.title: InstrumentSoftwareVersion
Keyword.Description: Instrument software version.

Keyword.title: ExposureTime
Keyword.Description: Total effective on-source exposure time of the observation. This is the total time during which photons from the object of interest are collected by the detector. It includes any shutter corrections (which may not apply for most (all?) SOFIA instruments), and nodding/chopping corrections, and should match the algorithm(s) supplied for any time estimation tools (e.g. SITE). For FITS, EXPTIME should be used instead of the FITS specification EXPOSURE. ExposureTime should be specified for all images in a data file.

Keyword.title: SpectralElement1
Keyword.Description: First spectral element (filter, grism, etc...) as specified in SI-DCS ICD. Need only contain the unique identifier from the SI-DCS ICD; more detailed filter/grism/mixer can be stored in instrument-specific keywords.

Keyword.title: SpectralElement2
Keyword.Description: Second spectral element (filter, grism, etc...) as specified in SI-DCS ICD. Need only contain the unique identifier from the SI-DCS ICD; more detailed filter/grism/mixer can be stored in instrument-specific keywords. Set to "NONE" If no second element in use.
Keyword.Comment: Second spectral element in use -- Set to "NONE" if no second element.

Keyword.title: InstrumentSlit
Keyword.Description: Slit identifier, as specified in the SI-DCS ICD. Need only contain the unique indentifier; more detialed info can be sotred in instrument-specific keywords.

Requirement.condition: Spectroscopy configs: if slit in use.

Keyword.title: WavelengthCentral
Keyword.Description: Central wavelength of observation for imaging modes. This is a rough figure only, intended to be used for archive searches across all SOFIA instruments.

Keyword.title: BandWidth
Keyword.Description: Bandwidth (wavelength) of observation: Filter bandwidth for imaging and wavelength range for spectroscopy. This is a rough figure only, intended to be used for archive searches across all SOFIA instruments.

Keyword.title: Resolution
Keyword.Description: Approximate spectral resolution of observation for spectroscopy modes, expressed as R = c/DeltaV = Lambda/DeltaLambda. This is a rough figure only, intended to be used for archive searches across all SOFIA instruments.

Keyword.title: DetectorChannel
Keyword.Description: Detector Channel as specified in the SI-DCS ICD.
Keyword.Comment: The values are FORCAST: SW | LW , FIFI-LS: BLUE | RED

Requirement.condition: FORCAST and FIFI-LS should populate these.

Keyword.title: TotalIntegrationTime
Keyword.Description: Total integration time (s)
Keyword.Comment: Total integration time (s), for FORCAST, If SKYMODE is C2NC2 or NXCAC, then TOTINT = DETITIME * 0.5, otherwise TOTINT = DETITIME*2.0

Keyword.title: Detector
Keyword.Description: Detector name.

Keyword.title: DetectorSize
Keyword.Description: Unbinned detector size in pixels.

Keyword.title: PixelScale
Keyword.Description: Projected pixel scale on the sky.

Keyword.title: Subarrays
Keyword.Description: Number of sub arrays used in data acquisition. Full array assumed if absent.

Keyword.title: SubarraySize
Keyword.Description: The log unbinned size of the n-th subarray in section notation.

Keyword.title: DataMaximum
Keyword.Description: The value field shall always contain a floating point number, regardless of the value of BITPIX. This number shall give the minimum valid physical value represented by the array, exclusive of any special values.

Keyword.title: DataMinimum
Keyword.Description: The value field shall always contain a floating point number, regardless of the value of BITPIX. This number shall give the minimum valid physical value represented by the array, exclusive of any special values.

Keyword.title: SaturationLevel
Keyword.Description: The value field shall always contain a floating point number, regardless of the value of BITPIX. This number shall give the approximate saturation value per raw frame of the array.

Keyword.title: DetectorAngle
Keyword.Description: Position angle of detector y axis with respect to celestial North. Usually reported as degrees east of north.

Keyword.title: ExposureCoadds
Keyword.Description: Number of coadded raw detector frames. This could also be number of coadds per chop position.

Keyword.title: ScienceInstrumentBoresightX
Keyword.Description: Location of SI boresight in pixel space -- x_si.
Keyword.Comment: SI Boresight (x) - as returned by MCCS, typo in name fixed

Keyword.title: ScienceInstrumentBoresightY
Keyword.Description: Location of SI boresight in pixel space -- y_si.
Keyword.Comment: SI Boresight (y) - as returned by MCCS, typo in name fixed

Keyword.title: WCS_CTYPE
Keyword.Description: WCS: Coordinate type and projection for n-th axis. See list of supported projections at http://tdc-www.harvard.edu/wcstools/wcstools.fits.html.

Keyword.title: WCS_CRPIX
Keyword.Description: WCS: pixel coordinates of the reference point of the n-th axis to which the projection and the rotation refer.
Keyword.Comment: Array location of the reference point in pixels for the n-th axis. Changed from int to float in revF

Keyword.title: WCS_CRVAL
Keyword.Description: WCS: reference pixel coordinate for n-th axis as right ascension and declination or longitude and latitude in decimal degrees. FITS Comment field should include estimate of uncertainty in absolute pointing (See TBD Document).
Keyword.Comment: Coordinate value at reference point for the n-th axis.

Keyword.title: WCS_CDELT
Keyword.Description: WCS: Plate scale in degrees per pixel for the n-th axis at the reference pixel. Either the CDi_j *or* the CDELT/CROTA keywords should be used, but not both. FITS comment field should include estimate of uncertainty based on known distortion or other optical effects.
Keyword.Comment: Plate scale for the n-th axis at reference point (deg/pixel).

Keyword.title: WCS_CROTA2
Keyword.Description: WCS: Rotation of axes in degrees. WCS FITS convention is to use CROTA2. Either the CDi_j *or* the CDELT/CROTA keywords should be used, but not both. FITS comment field should include estimate of uncertainty in TA rotation of field (see TBD Document).

Keyword.title: WCS_RotMatrix
Keyword.Description: WCS: Rotation matrix for WCS -- CD1_1, CD1_2, CD2_1, and CD2_2. Either the CDi_j *or* the CDELT/CROTA keywords should be used, but not both. FITS comment field should include estimate of uncertainty for each matirix element.

Keyword.title: FrontendDevice
Keyword.Description: Name of frontend device.

Keyword.title: BackendDevice
Keyword.Description: Name of backend device.

Keyword.title: BackendBandwidth
Keyword.Description: Total bandwidth of heterodyne backend (Hz).

Keyword.title: SystemTemperature
Keyword.Description: Heterodyne system temperature.

Keyword.title: FrequencyResolution
Keyword.Description: Nominal frequency resolution -- may differ from channel spacing.
Keyword.Comment: Nominal frequency resolution -- may differ from channel spacing.

Keyword.title: ReferenceFrequency
Keyword.Description: The observed frequency (Hz) at the reference pixel of the frequency-like axis.

Keyword.title: SidebandFrequency
Keyword.Description: The image sideband freq (Hz) corresponding to ReferenceFrequency.

Keyword.title: RestFrequency
Keyword.Description: Rest frequency.

Keyword.title: VelocityDefinition
Keyword.Description: The velocity definition and frame (8 characters). The first 4 characters describe the velicity definition. Possible definitions include: RADI (radio); OPTI (optical); RELA (relativistic). The second 4 characters describe the reference frame (e.g. ``-LSR'', ``-HEL'', ``-OBS''). If the frequency-like axis gives a frame, then the frame in VELDEF only applies to any velocities given as columns or keywords (virtual columns).

Keyword.title: VelocityFrame
Keyword.Description: The radial velocity of the reference frame wrt the observer. V_frame - V_telescope.

Keyword.title: RadialVelocity
Keyword.Description: The radial velocity, V_source - V_telescope.

Keyword.title: DataChecksum
Keyword.Description: Data checksum value for verifying the data. This follows the proposed FITS checksum standard.

Keyword.title: ChecksumVersion
Keyword.Description: Version of checksum method used for the checksums.

Keyword.title: ChopFrequency
Keyword.Description: Measured TCM chop frequency

Keyword.title: ChopProfile
Keyword.Description: Indicates whether 2 or 3 point chopping profile is being used. For 3-point chopping, the center position usually contains the object of interest. MCCS returns '0' for 2 point and '1' for 3-point.

Keyword.title: ChopSymmetry
Keyword.Description: Indicates whether symmetric or asymmetric chopping is being used.

Keyword.title: ChopAmplitude_1
Keyword.Description: Calculated amplitude on the sky. MCCS calculates the amplitude on the sky based on actual SMA data.

Keyword.title: ChopAmplitude_2
Keyword.Description: Calculated second amplitude on the sky. MCCS calculates the amplitude on the sky based on actual SMA data.

Keyword.title: ChopCoordSys
Keyword.Description: Reference frame for which MCCS computes SMA parameters. MCCS calculates sky_tip, sky_tilt, and sky_angle differently depending on which reference frame was last used in the sma.chop command. This value defaults to TARF if sma.chop has not been sent previously.
Keyword.Comment: MCCS Coordinate system for sky tip, tilt, and angle. Added SIRF in revF

Keyword.title: ChopAngle
Keyword.Description: Calculated angle in the sky_coord_sys reference frame. MCCS calculates the angle in the sky_coord_sys reference frame based on actual SMA data. The angle is the orientation of the chop throw with up equals zero.
Keyword.Comment: Calculated angle in the sky_coord_sys reference frame. Range increased in revF from -/+180 to -/+360

Keyword.title: ChopTip
Keyword.Description: Calculated tip in the sky_coord_sys reference frame. MCCS calculates the tip in the sky_coord_sys reference frame based on actual SMA data.
Keyword.Comment: Calculated tip in the sky_coord_sys reference frame.

Keyword.title: ChopTilt
Keyword.Description: Calculated tilt in the sky_coord_sys reference frame. MCCS calculates the tilt in the sky_coord_sys reference frame based on actual SMA data.
Keyword.Comment: Calculated tilt in the sky_coord_sys reference frame.

Keyword.title: ChopPhase
Keyword.Description: Chopper phase as defined by MCCS. Time delay between the synch signal and the start of the setpoint which has the positive tilt increment with respect to the commanded offset.
Keyword.Comment: Chop phase, User-supplied phase for the sma.chop command, changed to float in revF

Keyword.title: ChopSourceSignal
Keyword.Description: Indicates use of either internal or external chop signal.

Keyword.title: ChopACDC
Keyword.Description: Indicates whether the Chopper is being driven digitally or via the analog inputs.

Keyword.title: ChopFunction
Keyword.Description: Chopper waveform function.

Keyword.title: ChopSettleTime
Keyword.Description: Applied chopper settling time.

Keyword.title: NodDwellTime
Keyword.Description: Total time per nod position (dwell time) -- not including nod slew time and nod settle time (see NodSettleTime).

Keyword.title: NodCycles
Keyword.Description: Number of nod cycles.

Keyword.title: NodSettleTime
Keyword.Description: Time required for telescope to settle after nod slew is complete. Amount of time to wait between when telescope arrives at nod destination and when to begin integrating.

Keyword.title: NodAmplitude
Keyword.Description: Nod amplitude on sky.

Keyword.title: NodBeam
Keyword.Description: Current nod beam position.

Keyword.title: NodPattern
Keyword.Description: Pointing sequence pattern for one nod cycle (there could be many nod cycles in an observation). Beam A is usually assumed to contain the object of interest.
Keyword.Comment: Nodding pattern, one cycle. Added BA in revF

Keyword.title: NodStyle
Keyword.Description: Nodding style for coordinated chopping/nodding. e.g. nod-matched-chop, nod-perpendicular-chop, etc...

Keyword.title: NodCoordSys
Keyword.Description: Coordinate system in which nod positions (NODPOSX,Y) and rotations are defined.

Value.Range: ERF, ECRF, GALRF, TARF, FPIRF, FFIRF, WFIRF, SIRF, USER

Keyword.title: NodPositionX
Keyword.Description: ES nod offset position X in the coordinate frame specified by NODCRSYS. Alternate specification to NODDIST when an ES nod offset position is required.

Keyword.title: NodPositionY
Keyword.Description: ES nod offset position Y in the coordinate frame specified by NODCRSYS. Alternate specification to NODDIST when an ES nod offset position is required.

Keyword.title: NodAngle
Keyword.Description: Nod angle, clockwise from y axis defined by NODCRSYS.
Keyword.Comment: Nod angle, range increased in revF from -/+180 to -/+360

Keyword.title: DitherCoordiante
Keyword.Description: Coordinate system for dither offsets.
Keyword.Comment: Dither coordinate, needed by DPS for FORCAST, FLITECAM

Keyword.title: DitherXOffset
Keyword.Description: Specified dither offset X for each subsequent frame, in arcseconds.

Keyword.title: DitherYOffset
Keyword.Description: Specified dither offset Y for each subsequent frame, in arcseconds.

Keyword.title: DitherPattern
Keyword.Description: Approximate shape of dither pattern.
Keyword.Comment: Dither pattern, added NONE in revF

Keyword.title: DitherPositions
Keyword.Description: Number of dither positions.

Keyword.title: DitherPositionIndex
Keyword.Description: Dither position index.

Keyword.title: MapCoordSys
Keyword.Description: Coordinate system in which ES map positions are defined. OBSRA/DEC are assumed to describe position of Map Center.

Keyword.title: MapPattern
Keyword.Description: Approximate map pattern shape.

Keyword.title: MapPositionsX
Keyword.Description: Number of map positions in X coordinate as defined by MAPCRSYS.
Keyword.Comment: Number of map positions in X

Keyword.title: MapPositionsY
Keyword.Description: Number of map positions in Y coordinate as defined by MAPCRSYS.
Keyword.Comment: Number of map positions in Y

Keyword.title: MapIntervalX
Keyword.Description: Mapping step interval in X coordinate as defined by MAPCRSYS. OBSRA/DEC are assumed to describe position of Map Center.

Keyword.title: MapIntervalY
Keyword.Description: Mapping step interval in Y coordinate as defined by MAPCRSYS. OBSRA/DEC are assumed to describe position of Map Center.

Keyword.title: ScanStartRA
Keyword.Description: Start of scan - RA, coordinate system specified in keyword comment filed and EQUINOX.

Keyword.title: ScanStartDec
Keyword.Description: Start of scan - Dec , coordinate system specified in keyword comment filed and EQUINOX.

Keyword.title: ScanEndRA
Keyword.Description: End of scan - RA, coordinate system specified in keyword comment filed and EQUINOX.

Keyword.title: ScanEndDec
Keyword.Description: End of scan - Dec, coordinate system specified in keyword comment filed and EQUINOX.

Keyword.title: ScanRate
Keyword.Description: Commanded slew rate in arcsec/sec along path.

Keyword.title: ScanDirection
Keyword.Description: Angle on sky in some coordinate system to scan from ScanStartRA/Dec, alternative specification to ScanEndRA/Dec.
